coreSkills.name: UI/UX Design
coreSkills.description: Designing user interfaces and experiences. This involves creating visually appealing layouts and ensuring usability. It focuses on enhancing user satisfaction through intuitive design.

coreSkills.name: Wireframing
coreSkills.description: Creating wireframes to outline app structure. Wireframes serve as blueprints for the design process. They help visualize the layout and functionality of an application.

coreSkills.name: Prototyping
coreSkills.description: Building interactive prototypes for testing. Prototypes allow stakeholders to experience the product before development. They are essential for gathering feedback and refining ideas.

coreSkills.name: User Flows
coreSkills.description: Mapping user journeys through the app. User flows help identify the steps users take to achieve their goals. They ensure a seamless and logical navigation experience.

coreSkills.name: Responsive Design
coreSkills.description: Ensuring designs work on all devices. This involves creating layouts that adapt to different screen sizes. It improves accessibility and user experience across platforms.

coreSkills.name: HTML5
coreSkills.description: Structuring web content with HTML5. HTML5 provides semantic elements for better organization. It is the foundation of modern web development.

coreSkills.name: CSS3
coreSkills.description: Styling web pages with CSS3. CSS3 enables advanced styling and animations. It allows for creating visually engaging and dynamic websites.

coreSkills.name: JavaScript
coreSkills.description: Adding interactivity with JavaScript. JavaScript powers dynamic content and user interactions. It is a versatile language used in both frontend and backend development.

coreSkills.name: React
coreSkills.description: Building UI components with React. React simplifies the process of creating reusable components. It is widely used for building modern, scalable web applications.

toolsDaily.name: Figma
toolsDaily.description: Designing and prototyping interfaces. Figma is a collaborative tool that supports real-time editing. It is widely used for creating high-fidelity designs.

toolsDaily.name: Framer
toolsDaily.description: Creating animations and prototypes. Framer allows designers to build interactive and animated designs. It bridges the gap between design and development.

toolsDaily.name: Git
toolsDaily.description: Version control for code. Git tracks changes and enables collaboration among developers. It is essential for managing code in software projects.

toolsDaily.name: GitHub
toolsDaily.description: Hosting and collaborating on code. GitHub provides a platform for version control and code sharing. It supports open-source contributions and team workflows.

toolsDaily.name: VS Code
toolsDaily.description: Code editing with Visual Studio Code. VS Code offers a lightweight yet powerful development environment. It supports extensions for various programming languages.

toolsDaily.name: Vercel
toolsDaily.description: Deploying web applications. Vercel simplifies the process of hosting and scaling web apps. It is optimized for frontend frameworks like Next.js.

currentlyLearning.name: TypeScript
currentlyLearning.description: Learning strongly typed JavaScript. TypeScript enhances code quality and maintainability. It helps catch errors early during development.

currentlyLearning.name: Tailwind CSS
currentlyLearning.description: Using utility-first CSS framework. Tailwind CSS speeds up the styling process with pre-defined classes. It promotes consistency and reduces custom CSS code.

currentlyLearning.name: API-Integration
currentlyLearning.description: Connecting frontend with APIs. API integration enables data exchange between systems. It is crucial for building dynamic and data-driven applications.

currentlyLearning.name: Backend Basics
currentlyLearning.description: Understanding backend development. This includes learning about databases, servers, and APIs. It provides the foundation for full-stack development.
